articles.description: Among 1,300 individuals who tested positive twice, an ICMR study has found that 4.5% could be reinfection cases. Why are the rest ruled out as such, and what are the implications of the findings?
articles.content: In a first-of-its-kind exercise, a team of scientists from the Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) has identified a set of most plausible cases of reinfection of SARS-CoV2 virus in India. In a … [+5881 chars]

articles.author: ET HealthWorld
articles.title: Mutations could render Covid vax ineffective in a year: Experts - ETHealthworld.com
articles.description: The results published on Tuesday deliver a stark warning of the risk the world is taking by failing to ensure all countries have sufficient vaccines to protect people from Covid-19.
articles.content: New York: Mutations could render current Covid-19 vaccines ineffective in a year or less, according to two-thirds of 77 epidemiologists, virologists and infectious disease specialists from 28 countri… [+3518 chars]

articles.author: ET HealthWorld
articles.title: Covid-19 strains don't appear to be highly variable: Expert - ETHealthworld.com
articles.description: Writing an opinion piece in the magazine 'Scientific American', evolutionary microbiologist, Vaughn Cooper, said that the evidence suggest that SARS-CoV-2 variants that have emerged so far share similar combinations of mutations.
articles.content: New York: As the emergence of new Covid-19 variants from different parts of the world complicate the fight against the pandemic, there appears to be some silver lining now. This is because an expert … [+2034 chars]
